column2: MISSOURI PRACTICE PERMIT TEST
column4: Missouri
column6: MO

column2: Question Text
column4: Answer1 Text
column6: Answer2 Text

column2: 1. Drivers should use the horn:
column4: only when necessary, to avoid collisions.
column6: to alert other drivers that they made a mistake.
column10: if a driver is moving slowly, and you want them to drive faster.

column2: 2. If your car starts to skid, turn your steering wheel:
column4: to keep the front wheels straight.
column6: in any direction. It doesnt matter.
column8: in the direction you want to go.
column10: in the opposite direction of the skid.

column2: 3. When getting ready to change lanes, you should:
column4: check your rearview mirror.
column6: quickly turn your head to check for other vehicles.

column2: 4. Drivers can not pass a vehicle on the left if:
column4: they can not safely return to the right lane before they reach a solid yellow center line for the right lane.
column6: they are within 100 feet of a railroad crossing on a two-way roadway.
column8: they approach the top of a hill on a two-way road and can not see over it.

column2: 5. This sign warns ____________ ahead.
column4: that a reversible lane starts.
column6: of a reduction of lanes

column2: 6. This sign means:
column4: You must stop ahead
column6: There is a traffic signal ahead

column2: 7. After stopping for a school bus that is unloading children you should:
column4: watch for children walking along the side of the road.
column6: wait at least 4 minutes.

column2: 8. In heavy rain, tires can begin to ride on the water that is on top of the road pavement. This is called:
column4: hydroplaning.
column6: pavement-planing.

column2: 9. This sign indicates the _______________ vehicles can safely travel in this area.
column4: reaction speed
column6: suggested speed

column2: 10. This sign warns of a ________ ahead.
column4: no passing zone
column6: truck

column2: 11. A flashing red traffic light:
column4: has the same meaning as a yield sign.
column6: indicates that you should drive with caution.
column8: has the same meaning as a stop sign.
column10: is used to indicate a pedestrian crossing.

column2: 12. Where there is no bicycle lane, where on the road must a bicyclist ride?
column4: near the right curb or edge of the road.
column6: on the left shoulder of the road.
column8: near the left edge of the road.

column2: 13. When you make a left turn from a two-way road into a four-lane highway, you must:
column4: enter the right lane. When traffic permits, you can move out of the left lane.
column6: enter the right lane, to the left of the center line.
column8: go straight through the intersection, and then make the turn.
column10: enter the left lane, to the right of the center line.

column2: 14. This road sign means:
column4: One-way traffic
column6: Keep right
column10: Keep right, traffic is entering from another road.

column2: 15. When driving on a wet road:
column4: you must be aware that the pavement gets even more slippery when it's been raining for long periods of time.
column6: you should follow the vehicle ahead of you more closely.
column8: as you decrease your speed, the road becomes more slippery.
column10: as you drive faster, your tires may lose traction.

column2: 16. What do pennant-shaped signs indicate?
column4: A school crossing
column6: School crossing

column2: 17. What should you do if a vehicle is approaching head-on in your lane?
column4: Turn off the ignition if your vehicle has power steering.
column6: Decrease speed, pull over to the right and sound your horn to warn the other driver.
column8: Come to a complete stop and use your horn to warn the vehicles behind you.
column10: Pull over to the left and use your emergency lights to stop the other driver.

column2: 18. Two motorcyclists are allowed to:
column4: share the lane with another vehicle.
column6: exceed the posted speed limit when driving on expressways.
column10: ride side-by-side in a single lane.

column2: 19. To drive defensively, you must:
column4: use only one hand on the wheel.
column6: not check behind you through your mirrors.
column8: assume that a driver who approaches a STOP sign on a side road is actually going to stop.

column2: 20. When you reach an intersection with a stop sign, you should:
column4: check your rearview mirror, look left, then right, then proceed.
column6: follow the vehicle ahead of you.
column8: stop, look right, then left, then right again.
column10: stop, look left, then right, then left again.

column2: 21. Motor vehicle owners are required to keep proof of liability insurance:
column4: at home.
column6: in their mailbox.
column10: in their vehicle whenever it is being operated.

column2: 22. Alcohol causes:
column4: reduced perception.
column6: poor judgment.

column2: 23. Are drivers allowed to exceed the speed limit to pass other vehicles?
column4: Yes, but only if they drive with caution.
column6: Yes, but only by 10 MPH or less.

column2: 24. This sign warns drivers of:
column4: a winding road.
column6: a low place in the road.

column2: 25. What does this road sign indicate?
column4: Vehicles turning left must yield to bikes entering a right turn lane.
column6: Motor vehicles entering an exclusive right-turn lane must weave across bicycle traffic in bicycle lanes.
column8: Drivers have the right of way over bikes turning left.
